Ad Text:
Your Impact

 

 

You will play a pivotal role in shaping financial insight and supporting strategic decision-making across APAC region for Asahi Beverages. You will deliver timely, accurate, and meaningful financial analysis that supports decision making for the Executive leadership Team and the achievement of regional financial targets.

 

 

You will be the central point of financial consolidation for APAC, you will translate complex financial data into clear, concise, and high-quality Board-level reporting for our parent company in Japan (AGH). Through strong business partnering with Finance Leads across Business Units and Divisions, you will support regional planning, forecasting, and reporting processes—driving alignment, consistency, and performance in support of Asahi Beverages’ long-term growth strategy.

 

 

Key responsibilities

 

 

Deliver clear, concise month-end and Board reports, partnering with stakeholders to articulate key performance drivers and support executive decision-making.
Lead the Group management reporting agenda, continuously improving and simplifying reporting outputs.
Using Power BI dashboards, to enhance financial insight, efficiency, and transparency.
Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and consistency of financial reporting across all source systems and business units.
Support delivery of quarterly forecasts and the annual budget, working closely with senior finance leaders and Business Unit Finance teams to meet timelines and quality standards.

 

 

About You

 

 

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or a related discipline, with CA/CPA qualification (or near completion).
Previous experience in FP&A exposure and strong Board-level writing capability; suitable for first movers from professional services.
Experience in a large, complex organisation; FMCG experience highly preferred
Strong Excel and Power BI skills, with a strong analytical mindset and problem-solving capability.
Proven ability to lead process improvement and drive change in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional communication and influencing skills, with the ability to translate complex financial data into concise, succinct, actionable insights for senior Executive leadership team.

 

 

Why Asahi Beverages?

 

 

At Asahi Beverages, we're passionate about crafting more than just drinks - we craft moments of connection, celebration, and shared enjoyment. We bring together a diverse portfolio of iconic beverage brands, a commitment to quality, and a drive to constantly innovate.  Headquartered in Melbourne and with facilities right across Australia and New Zealand, you’ll find Asahi is a place where talent is nurtured, and ambition is rewarded. If you’re ready to toast your future, we’re ready to meet you. 

  

 

We are a Circle Back Initiative employer and commit to responding to all applicants.

Flexible Location within New Zealand and Australia

Daifuku Oceania is the industry leader in Intralogistics (warehousing and distribution) and Airport (Baggage Handling), self-service and Digital systems. We have offices and sites across New Zealand, Australia and Malaysia.

About the role
Reporting to the Transformation Director, you will successfully partner with key stakeholders within Daifuku Oceania providing support and guidance to promote improvements and efficiencies across a range of process and activities within the IFS ERP system in support of the strategic development and growth of the business. The responsibilities inclue ensuring strong data, process, financial and commercial frameworks are in place.

Your responsibilities include:

Actively work with Various Operations and Maintenance teams to roll our the Asset and Service Maintenance Module of IFS on a location -by-location basis.
Assist with upskilling and training of the Operations and Maintenance Teams
Work with the various teams across the organisation to desin, test and deploy process improvements and reporting on all modules 
Assist in developing an understanding of daifuku oceania systems, integrations, data flows specifically with the view to optimise IFS processes
Assist with IFS system administration and support
Work closely with relevant stakeholders including Daifuku and its affiliates, industry bodies, partners, consultants, clients, suppliers, etc to ensure a strong leel of trust and support.
About you
We are seeking a team player with a positive, proactive attitude, you’ll bring proven ERP system implementation experience in a multinational across a number of countries. 

IFS administration or configuration knowledge
Excel or PowerBI guru experience
ERP system implementation experience
Ability to facilitate user training
Ability to travel to sites, up to 2 weeks per trip
For You
Become part of a high performing team led by our passionate leadership team invested in your growth and development.

Team Benefits

Robust Employee Wellness Program
A Friendly, supportive and dynamic team
Multiple locations across New Zealand, Australia, Malaysia and Japan.
Peer to Peer recognition and Rewards Program
About Daifuku Oceania
Daifuku Oceania is a subsidiary of Daifuku Co. Ltd. a global business with over 13,000+ individuals worldwide, delivering material handling automation, self-service technology, and intralogistics solutions to our partners worldwide.

We are proud of our reputation as leaders within the aviation and logistics sectors, highly regarded for our technology and digital innovation.

Daifuku Oceania was founded in 1993 in New Zealand and is the global leader in material handling solutions driven by our vision and, most certainly, the exceptional people we employ.

Daifuku Oceania has offices in New Zealand, Australia, and Malaysia, employing 500+ dedicated team members to provide our clients end-to-end solutions and customer care globally.

Our Company Values

Think Safe - Act Safe - Home Safe
Outstanding service and value to customers (internal & external)
Respect and trust for each other.
To look beyond the obvious - creativity, innovation and continuous improvement
Having fun
Make Daifuku Your future – Apply now!
It's an exciting time to be part of Daifuku Oceania.

If you're looking to be valued for your expertise and grow your career in a global company offering world-class opportunities, apply now.

Please note we aim to review applications as they are received - therefore encourage you to apply at your earliest opportunity.

About Alberts

Alberts offers a premium hybrid workplace for businesses seeking to enhance their company culture. With a revolutionary office leasing model and private members work club, Alberts is home to aspirational workspaces, enhanced shared facilities and exceptional amenities. With properties located across seven central locations, Alberts inspires a community of Auckland's most ambitious minds and innovative businesses who can network and connect at Alberts events in our beautifully curated spaces.

We are currently expanding the Alberts model into Australia.

The Opportunity

We are seeking an experienced Fund Management Analyst to support our management team in the financial and strategic oversight of property investment funds. This role is responsible for delivering accurate and insightful analysis, preparing investor reporting, and assisting in the ongoing monitoring of fund performance, asset valuations, and capital management.

This is a dynamic analyst role offering variety and impact within a fast-paced, high-performing environment. No two days will be the same.

The role will work across a broad range of business activities from day-to-day operational optimisation to high impact strategic initiatives working closely with senior management.

Success in this role requires strong analytical skills, commercial acumen, and a proactive approach to problem solving. The ideal candidate will be resilient, adaptable, and an effective communicator, able to manage competing priorities and navigate complex stakeholder relationships while maintaining focus and balance under pressure.

What You'll Be Doing

Drive financial performance by updating and analysing development feasibilities and scenario models.

Evaluate new development and investment opportunities through robust financial analysis and due diligence coordination.

Prepare clear, compelling investment reports and recommendations for internal and external stakeholders.

Manage banking processes, including satisfaction of conditions precedent and coordination of loan documentation.

Deliver market and company insights through targeted research and maintenance of key data sets.

Monitor and report on fund and asset performance, providing actionable insights to senior management.

What You'll Bring

Bachelor's degree in finance, Commerce, Economics, Accounting, or related field (CFA/CA/CPA preferred but not essential).

2–4 years' experience in funds management, investment banking, corporate finance, property, or related financial services.

Advanced financial modelling and Excel skills, with strong quantitative analysis capabilities.

Solid understanding of investment principles, property markets, and valuation methodologies.

Proven ability to create high-quality investor reports, presentations, and pitch decks (advanced PowerPoint skills essential).

Knowledge of debt and equity structures in property funds is highly regarded.

Strong attention to detail, organisational skills, and a collaborative, solutions focused mindset, with the ability to thrive under pressure in dynamic and evolving business environment.

Why Join Alberts?

Be part of a visionary company shaping the future of workspaces

Gain exposure to all facets of fund management, from daily business optimisation to transformative strategic projects.

Learn from industry experts to support your professional development.
